Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the invertebrate defensin family
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.15197474]Gram-positive bacteria:Bacillus subtilis (MIC>50 µg/ml), Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC>50 µg/ml);Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli DH5a (MIC>50 µg/ml), Klebsiella pneumoniae ATCC 13883 (MIC>50 µg/ml).NOTE:Liquid growth inhibition assay.
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Swiss_Prot Entry Q6GU94]Non-hemolytic activity against human erythrocytes
Sequence Information.Function: Antibacterial protein involved in the immune response to septic injury. When combined with 14.026 kDa and 14.059 kDa hemolymph antimicrobial peptides, it has a strong cooperative activity against bacteria. No detectable antibacterial activity when present alone. Has no hemolytic activity against human erythrocytes.

Literature.Title: Antimicrobial peptide induction in the haemolymph of the Mexican scorpion Centruroides limpidus limpidus in response to septic injury.
Literature.Author: Rodríguez de la Vega RC, García BI, D'Ambrosio C, Diego-García E, Scaloni A, Possani LD.
